project_overview.name: Customer Onboarding and Success Portal (COSP)
project_overview.description: A portal that aims to reduce customer churn, improve time-to-value, increase CSM efficiency, and boost self-service rate.

feature_breakdown.description: Allow customers to log in using their main SaaS product credentials.
acceptance_criteria: Users can log in using their existing credentials
Secure session management and token-based authentication

feature_breakdown.description: Display an onboarding checklist based on the customer's subscription level.
acceptance_criteria: Checklists are tailored to the customer's subscription tier
Checklist items are clearly marked as completed/in-progress

feature_breakdown.description: Integrate with the existing knowledge base API to provide seamless content searching and viewing.
acceptance_criteria: Users can search and view all relevant knowledge base articles
Search results are relevant and paginated

feature_breakdown.description: Display a dashboard showing the customer's adoption metrics, such as daily active users and feature usage.
acceptance_criteria: Dashboard displays key adoption metrics in a clear and intuitive manner
Users can easily interpret and understand the data

feature_breakdown.description: Provide a 'Contact CSM' button that pre-populates an email or Zendesk ticket with customer details.
acceptance_criteria: Users can easily initiate a support request with their details pre-filled
Requests are properly routed to the assigned CSM

technical_architecture.data_flow: User requests -> API Gateway -> Integration Services -> Database/Third-Party APIs -> Response to User
security_considerations: Regularly audit and update security policies

implementation_phases.description: Deliver the core features for the initial launch.
Expand the portal's capabilities based on user feedback and data analysis.

risk_analysis.description: Integrating with multiple third-party systems may introduce complexities and delays.
risk_analysis.mitigation_strategy: Prioritize API integration tasks, establish clear communication channels with third-party vendors, and have a contingency plan for potential delays.

risk_analysis.description: Achieving the desired performance and scalability targets may be challenging.
risk_analysis.mitigation_strategy: Implement load testing, optimize database queries, and use caching mechanisms. Ensure the architecture is designed for scalability.

risk_analysis.description: Lack of user adoption due to poor usability or a mismatch between features and user needs.
risk_analysis.mitigation_strategy: Conduct user research, involve stakeholders in the design process, and continuously gather feedback to iteratively improve the portal.

success_metrics.target_value: Decrease by 5 percentage points within 12 months
success_metrics.measurement_method: Monthly tracking of customer retention data

success_metrics.target_value: Reduce average TTV from 30 days to 14 days within 6 months
success_metrics.measurement_method: Monitoring of first feature adoption timelines

success_metrics.target_value: Reduce time spent on manual onboarding tasks by 25%
Increase the percentage of support questions resolved via the portal to 40%
success_metrics.measurement_method: Analyzing support ticket data and portal usage analytics
